items.question: How can I book a stay with Lau's Paws?
items.answer: The best way to get in touch is via the form on our contact page. Alternatively, you can make a booking via WhatsApp or with a Facebook message.

items.question: How far in advance do I need to book?
items.answer: Many clients book months in advance but if you can only book a few weeks in advance we'll always try to accommodate you if we have space. That said, you should book as far in advance as possible, especially for busier periods such as weekends, school holidays, and special dates such as Christmas and New Year.

items.question: Can I schedule a meet-and-greet before booking?
items.answer: Once availability has been confirmed, it is our policy to always have a meet-and-greet before any new booking.

items.question: Does my dog need to have a trial stay?
items.answer: Yes, all new bookings must have a trial stay to make sure your dog is a good fit for Lau's Paws. We can then arrange a daytime or overnight trial stay on a date that's convenient for both parties. Standard rates apply and are non-refundable.

items.faq_question: Do I have to pay a deposit to reserve a stay?
items.faq_answer: Yes, you'll need to pay 25% of the cost of the total stay to secure your booking. This deposit is non-refundable.

items.question: Do you accept large breed dogs?
items.answer: No, we only accept small to medium-sized dogs. If you're unsure whether your breed qualifies as medium, please get in touch to check.

items.question: Do you have age restrictions for dogs?
items.answer: Unfortunately I cannot accept puppies under one year of age. My dog Lila is very friendly and patient but she is now 10 and prefers to share her home with calmer canine companions.

items.question: How many dogs can stay at the same time?
items.answer: My licence allows me to have three boarders and my own dog, Lila, at the same time. This guarantees your dog lots more attention and comfort than commercial dog-boarding centres, but means they get the opportunity to play and socialise too.

items.question: Does my dog need to be house-trained?
items.answer: Yes, we only accept fully house-trained dogs. This ensures a clean and comfortable environment for all dogs staying with us.

items.question: What is the daily routine for the dogs in your care?
items.answer: Our days usually start with a toilet trip to the garden, followed by breakfast and a morning walk in one of the open spaces near my home. After lunch, the dogs are free to nap or play, then we go out in the afternoon for a second walk before dinner and finish the day with snuggles on the sofa before bed.

items.question: Where will my dog sleep?
items.answer: My dog Lila sleeps in bed with me and any dogs in my care are welcome to do the same. If you'd prefer, however, they can sleep anywhere in my home, such as on the sofa, curled up in a doggie bed in the living room, or even in the kitchen.

items.question: Do I need to provide my dog's food?
items.answer: Food is included in the price of boarding. That said, if you dog follows a particular diet and has their own special food then you would need to provide enough for the length of their stay when dropping them off.

items.question: Will my dog get one-on-one attention during their stay?
items.answer: Absolutely! Since Lau's Paws can only welcome three boarders at a time, we can give each dog plenty of individual attention, playtime, and affection throughout the day.
